columns_per_table: users: id(INT PRIMARY KEY), username(VARCHAR(50)), email(VARCHAR(100)), created_at(TIMESTAMP)
products: id(INT PRIMARY KEY), name(VARCHAR(200)), price(DECIMAL(10,2)), category_id(INT)
orders: id(INT PRIMARY KEY), user_id(INT), total_amount(DECIMAL(10,2)), order_date(TIMESTAMP)
order_items: id(INT PRIMARY KEY), order_id(INT), product_id(INT), quantity(INT), price(DECIMAL(10,2))
categories: id(INT PRIMARY KEY), name(VARCHAR(100)), description(TEXT)
inventory: id(INT PRIMARY KEY), product_id(INT), stock_quantity(INT), last_updated(TIMESTAMP)
payments: id(INT PRIMARY KEY), order_id(INT), amount(DECIMAL(10,2)), payment_method(VARCHAR(50)), status(VARCHAR(20))
reviews: id(INT PRIMARY KEY), product_id(INT), user_id(INT), rating(INT), comment(TEXT), created_at(TIMESTAMP)
